div.ab: To free a prisoner (obtained from a convert): Take flour from two women who live with (lit. under) their first husbands and milk from a woman and her daughter. And make a cake from the milk and the flour and send the cake to the prisoner, and he will eat the cake, and will say to he who is with him that he may eat with him, and if he does not want to, it is no problem. And every hour that he eats, he should say these names: Christus actus (???) ibant (???) fictusex mortus. And it is clear that he will soon be released. And one should not use this if he is not in extreme need, for this is a profane name.
